intro: Gochnatia integerrima, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and often have a distinctive grayish-green color. The flowers bloom in spring and summer, producing small, tubular florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
